author: William Fiuza

text: Beautiful. The entire Zelda series has really great music for each of its little villages. Seriously--when first playing this game, not only was it what I hoped LoZ would be in terms of visuals & gameplay (enormous environments, differing architecture for each place, and a penchant for nature), but the background music itself is absolutely astounding.

author: Recht_voor_zijn_raap

text: I'll be posting my Top 15 GOTY 2018 in February as I still want to finish a couple games. Yes, Top 15 this time because I liked too many games to only list and talk about 10 of them, so I do what I do best when I'm stuck in a situation: I create my own rules. There was something about this village, arguably the least important one in the game as it's completely optional. Somehow, it's the village that surprised me the most upon discovering it as I was just minding my own business along the coast and beaches. It was like stumbling upon that small and peaceful fishing resort, all with its own relaxing theme. This game was full of those joyful moments, it's truly special.
